title: Connecting Makerspaces Across Central Illinois - UIUC Focus
description: Comprehensive list of makerspaces, machine shops, and maker organizations for entrepreneurs and makers at the University of Illinois Urbana-Champaign and surrounding area

makerspaces.name: Siebel Center for Design - The Shop
makerspaces.address: Siebel Center for Design, UIUC Campus, Urbana, IL
makerspaces.description: Multi-disciplinary makerspace with comprehensive fabrication facilities
makerspaces.target_audience: All UIUC students, faculty, staff - all disciplines welcome
makerspaces.access_model: Priority to first-time learners, trained users welcome as space allows
makerspaces.mission: Human-centered design focal point bringing together people from all disciplines, cultures, and realities

makerspaces.name: Grainger IDEA Lab
makerspaces.address: Lower-level West Wing, Grainger Engineering Library, UIUC Campus, Urbana, IL
makerspaces.description: Innovation and Discovery in Engineering & the Arts Lab with emerging technologies
makerspaces.target_audience: All UIUC faculty, staff, and students - all majors welcome
makerspaces.access_model: Access must be approved, space/equipment reservation required
makerspaces.mission: Provides access to latest emerging technologies for collaboration, innovation, and entrepreneurship

makerspaces.name: Illinois MakerLab
makerspaces.address: Business Instructional Facility, Room #3030, 515 E. Gregory Dr., Champaign, IL 61820
makerspaces.description: World's first business school 3D printing lab focusing on design, manufacturing, and marketing
makerspaces.mission: Teaching users how to design, manufacture, and market physical objects

makerspaces.name: EnterpriseWorks Makerspace
makerspaces.address: EnterpriseWorks, Room #143, 60 Hazelwood Drive, Champaign, IL 61820
makerspaces.description: Shared makerspace for startups and Research Park tenants
makerspaces.mission: Supporting startup development and corporate innovation

makerspaces.name: Health Maker Lab
makerspaces.address: Carle Illinois College of Medicine, UIUC Campus, Urbana, IL
makerspaces.description: Medical student entrepreneur hub for healthcare innovation
makerspaces.target_audience: Medical students collaborating with engineering, business, and science students
makerspaces.mission: Translating ideas into innovations, designs into prototypes, teams into start-ups for healthcare solutions

makerspaces.name: Champaign-Urbana Community Fab Lab
makerspaces.address: 1301 South Goodwin Avenue Art E Annex, Studio 2, Urbana, IL 61801
makerspaces.description: Open collaborative workshop space for computer-driven innovation, design and fabrication
makerspaces.target_audience: UIUC campus and community members, all ages
makerspaces.access_model: Completely free access, very low cost materials
makerspaces.mission: Enable makers to imagine, design and create using open source software and DIY equipment
makerspaces.university_connection: Program of Illinois Informatics Institute, collaborates with iSchool, College of Education, College of Fine and Applied Arts

makerspaces.name: Makerspace Urbana
makerspaces.address: 202 S. Broadway Ave, Urbana, IL (Urbana-Champaign Independent Media Center basement)
makerspaces.description: Open community lab blending arts, humanities, science and technology
makerspaces.target_audience: People of diverse backgrounds for learning, teaching, tinkering, collaboration
makerspaces.mission: Provide an open community lab where people can learn, teach, tinker, collaborate, share, innovate, socialize, and create

student_organizations.name: Maker Network RSO
student_organizations.address: Siebel Center for Design, UIUC Campus, Urbana, IL
student_organizations.description: RSO focused on making makerspaces more sustainable and connecting students with campus resources
facilities: Sheet press for acrylic waste recycling
student_organizations.target_audience: UIUC students interested in sustainable making
student_organizations.mission: Increasing sustainability in maker spaces, connecting students with campus resources, central resource for Champaign Urbana maker community

library_makerspaces.name: The Studio at the Library
library_makerspaces.address: Champaign Public Library, Main Library, Champaign, IL
library_makerspaces.description: 8,000 square foot innovative space with makerspace, recording booths, computer lab, and gaming area
library_makerspaces.access_model: Drop-in hours, some equipment requires reservation
library_makerspaces.mission: Provide creative tools and space for community making and learning
library_makerspaces.hours: Drop in Saturdays (9-6) and Sundays (12-6), plus special Thursday and Friday hours (5-8)

library_makerspaces.name: Imagine Lab
library_makerspaces.description: Makerspace established in memory of Karen Kerns Dresser offering public access to technology and DIY equipment
library_makerspaces.target_audience: Public with valid Champaign County Library card
library_makerspaces.access_model: Appointment only, signed release form required
library_makerspaces.mission: Support lifelong learning and community interaction through technology access
library_makerspaces.hours: By appointment, normally 10am to one hour before library closing

library_makerspaces.name: Teen Open Lab
library_makerspaces.address: 210 West Green Street, Urbana, IL 61801 (Urbana Free Library - Lewis Auditorium)
library_makerspaces.description: Teen-guided space with makerspace programming and peer instruction
facilities: Collaborative with CU Community Fab Lab equipment
library_makerspaces.target_audience: Teens (middle school and high school age)
library_makerspaces.mission: Teen-guided space promoting collaboration and peer instruction
library_makerspaces.hours: Afternoon hours when Lewis Auditorium not otherwise occupied

machine_shops.name: MATRICS Inc.
machine_shops.address: MATRICS Inc., 60 Hazelwood Drive, Champaign, IL 61820
machine_shops.description: Design and engineering services specializing in CNC machining for startups and small companies
machine_shops.target_audience: Startups, small companies, independent creators, entrepreneurs
machine_shops.mission: Providing quick, accurate and affordable manufacturing services for startups and small companies
machine_shops.notes: Graduate of EnterpriseWorks in Research Park. Founded by UIUC mechanical engineering graduates Richard and Robert Mauge who built their own CNC machines to meet startup manufacturing needs.

machine_shops.name: Wagner Machine Co.
machine_shops.description: High precision, high tech manufacturing and CNC services
services: Complex turned parts up to 1.25" diameter
machine_shops.target_audience: Manufacturers, engineers, entrepreneurs needing precision parts
machine_shops.lead_times: 4-6 weeks for 50-5,000 parts, 5-8 weeks for orders over 5,000 parts

machine_shops.name: Illinois Valley Machine
machine_shops.type: Full Service CNC and Manual Machine Shop
machine_shops.description: Established 1986, provides machining services to major manufacturers
machine_shops.access_model: Commercial services, mobile services available nationwide

campus_machine_shops.name: Physics Machine Shop
campus_machine_shops.address: 144 Seitz Materials Research Lab (MRL), UIUC Campus, Urbana, IL
campus_machine_shops.description: Professional machine shop specializing in special one-of-a-kind research equipment for physics research
campus_machine_shops.materials: Gold, silver, platinum, iridium, tantalum, titanium, magnesium, molybdenum, stainless steel, inconel, tool steels, machinable ceramics (Macor), tungsten, composite materials, Teflon, Delrin, Nylon
campus_machine_shops.access_model: Professional services ($66/hour + materials), Student training ($30/hour), Student access ($6.50/15 min)

contact.supervisor: Eric Thorsland, Research Lab Shop Supervisor

campus_machine_shops.booking: Contact Physics Business Office to become preauthorized PI, then order online

campus_machine_shops.name: SCS Machine Shop (Chemistry)
campus_machine_shops.address: Room B71 Roger Adams Lab, UIUC Campus, Urbana, IL
campus_machine_shops.description: School of Chemical Sciences machine shop for building and repairing specialized research equipment
services: Ultra-high vacuum equipment fabrication and repair

campus_machine_shops.name: Aerospace Engineering Research Machine Shop
campus_machine_shops.address: Room 4 Talbot Laboratory, 104 S. Wright St., Urbana, IL 61801
campus_machine_shops.description: Serves faculty, staff, and students throughout College of Engineering and across UIUC campus
campus_machine_shops.target_audience: Aerospace Engineering faculty, staff, students; College of Engineering; UIUC campus

campus_machine_shops.name: MechSE Pro Maker Shop
campus_machine_shops.address: 0045 Sidney Lu Mechanical Engineering Building, UIUC Campus, Urbana, IL
campus_machine_shops.description: Professional machine shop making design plans a reality with advanced fabrication capabilities

waterjet_specs.materials: Metal, plastic, glass, ceramic, stone, composites

campus_machine_shops.access_model: Walk-in consultations during regular hours, project-based services
campus_machine_shops.hours: Walk-in consultations available during regular hours (afternoons preferred, urgent needs after 8:15am)

metal_3d_printing.location: Professor Katie Matlack's Wave Propagation and Metamaterials Lab
metal_3d_printing.materials: Sintered stainless steel, bronze-infiltrated stainless steel

makerworks_studio.equipment: Saws, Inventables CNC router, Bosch hand tools

campus_machine_shops.name: ECE Machine Shop
campus_machine_shops.address: Electrical & Computer Engineering Building, Rooms 1047-1048, UIUC Campus, Urbana, IL
campus_machine_shops.description: Electrical and Computer Engineering departmental machine shop supporting ECE research and projects

campus_machine_shops.name: Life Sciences Machine Shop
campus_machine_shops.address: Room 59 Burrill Hall, 407 South Goodwin Avenue, Urbana, IL
campus_machine_shops.description: Provides variety of services for School of Molecular & Cellular Biology, School of Integrative Biology, and other campus units
specialty_services: Lab water system maintenance and repair
Laboratory refrigeration system diagnosis and repair
campus_machine_shops.target_audience: School of Molecular & Cellular Biology, School of Integrative Biology faculty, staff, students, other campus units

regional_makerspaces.name: The Petrick Idea Center
regional_makerspaces.address: Illinois Wesleyan University, Bloomington, IL (Connected to Ames School of Art and Design)
regional_makerspaces.description: State-of-the-art innovation center with fully-equipped makerspaces fostering interdisciplinary collaboration and entrepreneurship
regional_makerspaces.space: Approximately 15,000 square feet of newly constructed space and 8,000 square feet of renovated space
regional_makerspaces.target_audience: Illinois Wesleyan students from all disciplines interested in innovation and entrepreneurship
regional_makerspaces.mission: Interdisciplinary innovation, collaboration and creativity grounded in liberal arts, connecting disciplines for entrepreneurial solutions
regional_makerspaces.distance_from_uiuc: Approximately 50 miles south of UIUC campus
notable_features: Connected to Ames School of Art and Design
Named after Ellen (Reid) '68 and Dave Petrick '67
Focus on 'do well, do good' entrepreneurship
